item.title: Saks Global’s near bankruptcy is the result of risky dealmaking—and a neglect of business basics
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The U.S. naval blockade of Venezuela has cost $700 million already—and is rising by $9 million daily
item.description: Trump is urging U.S. oil companies to return to Venezuela but question marks remain with instability, high costs, and weak oil prices.

item.title: More Americans will die than be born in 2030, CBO predicts—leaving immigrants as the only source of population growth
item.description: Deportations shrank this timeline by a decade, putting unprecedented pressure on Social Security.

item.title: These are the 10 most on-time airlines in the world, and only one American company made the cut
item.description: The only U.S. airline on Cirium’s top 10 list came in last place.

item.title: Trump threatens to ban Wall Street from buying the house next door, saying ‘American Dream is increasingly out of reach for far too many people’
item.description: Trump has not yet released draft legislation or an executive order, but officials and outside analysts say the administration is exploring several ave...
